page.title: 06The Manor School,Hadley
page.content: The Manor School is a comprehensive school built in 1958 to replace schools in Ketley and Hadley village. 43 staff are responsible for 740 children arranged in 28 tutor groups. The present Headteacher,Mr.J.C. Thornton,has held the post for 5 years,during which time the numbers on roll have fallen from 900 to 740.The projected number for Sept.'85 is 680. The school curriculum is varied, covering sciences,arts,crafts and technology.17 subjects are on offer including 3 languages,English,French and German.All pupils study English and Mathematics.Computer Studies is a popular choice among many students. There is a comprehensive list of sports and clubs in which the children can take part.
